description:
Morioka Kouhei wants to become a photographer. Unfortunately, he has the tendency to unintentionally capture the images of ghosts on film.

One day, he visits an old castle in Germany where he meets a vampire girl, Hazuki. It turns out that Hazuki is confined in the castle against her will. She tries to turn Kouhei into her slave by sucking his blood, with the intent to have him break the device sealing her in the castle. Although Kouhei proves to be immune to the vampire's curse, he is eventually forced to help her. Hazuki successfully escapes from the castle and leaves for Japan to look for her mother.

When she arrives in Japan, she goes to Kohei's house where he lives with his grandfather, who agrees to take in the girl. Due to his own childhood experiences, the sympathetic Kouhei agrees to aid Hazuki in her quest.

However, other vampires, including Elfried and Count Kinkell, manage to track Hazuki to Japan. They will stop at nothing to retrieve her.

(Source: AnimeNfo)

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

name.native: ハインリヒ・フォン・キンケル

node.description:
__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.

__Non anime roles:__
- Azami - Xenoblade Chronicles 2 (VG)
- Dorothy - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Jean](https://anilist.co/character/190865/Jean-Gunnhildr) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Kotori Kanbe](https://anilist.co/character/37486/) - Rewrite (VG)
- Mayer - Arknights (VG)
- [Wakamo Kosaka](https://anilist.co/character/287031/) - Blue Archive (VG)
- Changli - Wuthering Waves (VG)
- Castorice - Honkai Star Rail (VG)
- Metis - Persona 3 Reload : Episode Aigis -The Answer (VG)

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ccarrollbeard) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/colleen.clinkenbeardvoiceactress)

An American voice actress and theatre actress, working mainly in the commercial and dubbing industries. She has also served as ADR director, line producer, and script writer for several anime titles for Funimation.

She gave birth to her first son, Rhodes Vandelo Carroll, on September 4, 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ccarrollbeard) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/colleen.clinkenbeardvoiceactress)

An American voice actress and theatre actress, working mainly in the commercial and dubbing industries. She has also served as ADR director, line producer, and script writer for several anime titles for Funimation.

She gave birth to her first son, Rhodes Vandelo Carroll, on September 4, 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ccarrollbeard) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/colleen.clinkenbeardvoiceactress)

An American voice actress and theatre actress, working mainly in the commercial and dubbing industries. She has also served as ADR director, line producer, and script writer for several anime titles for Funimation.

She gave birth to her first son, Rhodes Vandelo Carroll, on September 4, 2014.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/brinapalencia) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/brinakins/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/brina.palencia.7)

Brina Michelle Palencia is an American voice actress who has voiced a number of English-language versions of characters featured in anime. She's a graduate of University of North Texas. [Gino Palencia](https://anilist.co/staff/104093), her brother, also works for Funimation.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Birth place: Osaka Prefecture, Japan        E-mail: arima@waruwaru.com (Japanese)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

Akiyuki Shinbou is a Japanese director, producer, animator and storyboard artist. He joined Studio One Pattern in 1981. He made his directorial debut with [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/) in 1994. He joined Shaft in 2004. He has received the 11th Tokyo Anime Award and the 2011 Newtype Anime Award for Best director for his work on the acclaimed anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/).

Shinbou was born in Fukushima Prefecture. After high school, he attended Tokyo Designer Institute before entering the anime industry.

After graduating from Tokyo Design Institute, Shinbou worked as an animator for the 1981 anime series [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/). Shinbou participated with Studio Pierrot in 1990 as an episode director in [Musashi](https://anilist.co/anime/8065/). His first full directorial debut was however the previously mentioned, with Metal Fighter Miku. He continued his early directional career with several OVA series in the late 90's. Shinbou participated with Seven Arcs starting with [Triangle Heart: Sweet Songs Forever](https://anilist.co/anime/176/) in 2003 and then became director for 2004's spin-off [Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha](https://anilist.co/anime/76/).

His style in particular became noticed during his episode direction work on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/)'s Dark Tournament arc. After seeing Shinbou's stylized presence, the new president of Shaft, [Mitsutoshi Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/151830/), approached Shinbou with the desire to make Shaft a distinctive studio among animation companies. In an interview, Kubota cited [Le Portrait de Petit Cossette](https://anilist.co/anime/514/) and [The SoulTaker](https://anilist.co/anime/1048/) among Shinbou's most distinctive products that caught his eye.

His work at Shaft has been characterized by extensive experimentation within the visual medium of animation, and often includes pictures taken from real life cut into scenes, as well as art shifts, beat panels, kabuki sound effects, textures that remain stationary when the textured object moves, showing symbols or defining parts of a character in place of characters during dialogue, written text in place (in opposition to dialogue), precise use of fan service, and "head-tilting", a style known as a Shaft specialty.

He says that the reason he sticks with Shaft is due to their system and professional capacity, which make his expression of direction much easier. The so-called "Team Shinbou" includes himself, [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and [Shin Oonuma](https://anilist.co/staff/101753/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

(Source: Wikipedia)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関島眞頼)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

Oishi worked at Studio Junio at the beginning of his career, and soon after joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he debuted as a key animator on [Mobile Suit Victory Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/89/) in 1993. [Hideyuki Morioka](https://anilist.co/staff/101526/) and [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) were among his co-workers at the studio. In 1994, Oishi got involved on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/) as a key animator and during its production he met [Akiyuki Shinbou](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/), a prolific episode director on the series and a to be long-time colleague and friend of his. Oishi continued working as a freelance animator through the '90s.

In 2001, he made his directorial debut with the 46th episode of [Cyborg 009: The Cyborg Soldier](https://anilist.co/anime/1678/). Soon after this he started getting involved in studio [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/)'s works with aforementioned Shinbou. In 2009, Shinbou and him directed [Bakemonogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/5081/) together, with Oishi serving as the chief director. In 2016, he directed the movie trilogy [Kizumonogatari](https://anilist.co/anime/9260/), which is considered to be his magnum-opus. Oishi usually draws his works' storyboards himself, and is known for taking a long time finishing them. Kizumonogatari's storyboards took him several years to complete.

[Naoyuki Tatsuwa](https://anilist.co/staff/103584/), who has also been involved in many of Shaft's projects, called him the "[Togashi](https://anilist.co/staff/96893/) of Shaft."

Oishi worked at Studio Junio at the beginning of his career, and soon after joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/亀山俊樹)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).
[Website](http://gingami.art.coocan.jp/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.
